This short course gives an overview of the requirements for the QMS (Quality Management System) at the project level and helps to successfully implement them.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project management is a discipline of initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and control of the team work to achieve project goals and meet project success criteria. The application of management methods (Knowledge, Skills, Tools, Techniques) to project activities (planning, executing & controlling) ensures delivery of a product of a desired quality.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project plan\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"– this objectives,\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"key requirements of the client or Customer. Quality control covers verification and validation activities.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/8620fc46-5def-47b1-bc72-12df36578f68/Project%20Management%20-%20Project%20Planning.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":1344,\"height\":934}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project execution\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"At the execution stage, \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://epam.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/policy/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BCE1731F5-88BB-4BA4-AF23-B786910434D2%7D&file=PID_AgileProjectManagementPlan.dotx&action=default&mobileredirect=true\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project Management Plan\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" is put into motion and project execution starts. It is important to maintain, control and communicate the progress as needed during execution. Project team will perform assigned tasks and work status is reported through regular team meetings as defined in the Communication plan. Delivery Manager/Project Manager uses this information to control the direction of the project by comparing the progress reports/status with the project plan to measure the performance of the project activities and take corrective actions, if needed. The first action always should be to bring the project back on course (i.e., to return it to the original plan). If that cannot happen, the team should record variations from the original plan and publish modifications done to the plan to all the stakeholders. Throughout this step, project sponsors and other key stakeholders should be kept informed of the project's status as per the agreed frequency in the Communication plan. Delivery Manager/Project Manager verifies project deliverables produced at all stages of a project before handing them over to Customer. Verification criteria should be aligned with acceptance criteria. The fact of verification must be documented. Once all the deliverables have been produced and the Customer has accepted the final solution, the project is ready for closure.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"DM/PM should monitor the following:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Overall project progress and performance against estimated scope, effort, schedule, resources, knowledge and skills, and budget. This involves analysis of project metrics values and review of task statuses;\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Team utilization and performance. DM/PM checks Team utilization level and monitors their workload;\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project skillset, training, knowledge transfer;\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project risks - see [\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://epam.sharepoint.com/sites/policy/SitePages/Policy/Process Descriptions/Process Description Risk Management.aspx?path=Delivery%20Process%20Areas\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"RskM\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"];\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project data and project work environment. Handbook.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/fd6f28c1-4cc8-441b-b532-92f094ca3acc/image2017-12-21%2011:59:27.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":1343,\"height\":934}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project closure\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"During the Project closure, or completion stage, the emphasis is on releasing the final deliverables to the Customer, archiving the project documentation, getting approval/acceptance from the Customer on the deliverables, terminating supplier contracts, releasing project resources, revoking the access of the project resources and communicating the closure of the project to all stakeholders. Delivery Manager/Project Manager should conduct Project Closure meeting including all the relevant stakeholders. In the project closure meeting Delivery Manager/Project Manager captures lessons-learned from the project to examine what went well and what didn't, Performance of the Project with respect to the defined goals, Best practices, Re-Usable components, and process improvements proposals. Best practices or lessons learned can be captured at any stage of the project.\\nThrough this type of analysis, the experience and knowledge are transferred back to the project organization, which will help future project teams.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/8bded8de-18d1-46b4-b6fc-9a600c3b0bed/image2017-12-21%2011:59:50.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":1067,\"height\":762}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Security engineering principles, every project must follow EPAM security rules (see As a minimum, it is necessary to define the list of customer's tools and the list of positions/team inside the project, which have access to customer's tools.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"All security requirements agreed between EPAM and Customer must be implemented and maintained.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If security requirements are implemented according to an international standard (ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, etc.), it is necessary to specify this fact in EPAM Internal Project Management Tool project properties by giving a standard name there. It will help compliance specialists to identify projects that potentially need assistance in implementing security requirements and track these cases.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project specific security risks must be considered.
